greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Irregular triangle read by rows: row n lists the divisors of n in decreasing order.
comment: Old name was "Replace n by its divisors in reverse order."
This gives the second elements of the ordered pairs (a,b), a >= 1, b >= 1, ordered by their product ab.
The 2nd column of the triangle is the largest proper divisor (A032742). - _Charles Kusniec_, Jan 30 2021
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Rows n = 1..1000 of triangle, flattened
Omar E. Pol, Illustration of the divisors of n - _Omar E. Pol_, Nov 22 2009
maple: cdr := proc(l) if 0 = nops(l) then ([]) else (l[2..nops(l)]): fi: end:
reverse := proc(l) if 0 = nops(l) then ([]) else [op(reverse(cdr(l))), l[1]]; fi: end:
mathematica: Table[Reverse@ Divisors@ n, {n, 27}] // Flatten (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Jul 27 2016 *)
xref: Cf. A027750 for the first elements, A056534, A168017, A000005 (row lengths), A000203 (row sums), A032742 (largest proper divisor).
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Jun 20, 2000
ext: Definition revised by _N. J. A. Sloane_, Jul 27 2016
